segment.source: Part 2: Mobile deployment using Windows Provisioning
segment.target: Part 2: Mobile deployment using Windows Provisioning

segment.source: Part 2: Mobile deployment using Windows Provisioning
segment.target: Part 2: Mobile deployment using Windows Provisioning

segment.source: In this section, we'll go through the process of customizing and building a mobile image using the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).
segment.target: In this section, we'll go through the process of customizing and building a mobile image using the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).

segment.source: Windows ICD provides a hybrid method for customizing and building a mobile image because it lets you use both a Windows Provisioning answer file (WPAF) to configure the runtime settings, enterprise policies, and enrollment settings available in Windows Provisioning, and a Managed Centralized Settings Framework (MCSF) customization answer file (CAF) to fully customize the device hardware and connectivity settings, preload apps, and add assets such as ringtones and localized strings.
segment.target: Windows ICD provides a hybrid method for customizing and building a mobile image because it lets you use both a Windows Provisioning answer file (WPAF) to configure the runtime settings, enterprise policies, and enrollment settings available in Windows Provisioning, and a Managed Centralized Settings Framework (MCSF) customization answer file (CAF) to fully customize the device hardware and connectivity settings, preload apps, and add assets such as ringtones and localized strings.

segment.source: Use the Windows ICD UI to customize and build a mobile image
segment.target: Use the Windows ICD UI to customize and build a mobile image

segment.source: If you are new to Windows mobile development, this is the best place to start.
segment.target: If you are new to Windows mobile development, this is the best place to start.

segment.source: Use the Windows ICD CLI to customize and build a mobile image
segment.target: Use the Windows ICD CLI to customize and build a mobile image

segment.source: This method uses the Windows ICD CLI to build a customized mobile image.
segment.target: This method uses the Windows ICD CLI to build a customized mobile image.

segment.source: Before proceeding with either of the walkthroughs, you must first complete the steps in Prepare for Windows mobile development and Configure the Start layout.
segment.target: Before proceeding with either of the walkthroughs, you must first complete the steps in Prepare for Windows mobile development and Configure the Start layout.

segment.source: Windows Provisioning/Windows ICD understands MCSF CAF so if you want to learn how to create a CAF, see Configure customization settings.
segment.target: Windows Provisioning/Windows ICD understands MCSF CAF so if you want to learn how to create a CAF, see Configure customization settings.
